name: Influenza
description: Influenza, commonly known as the flu, is a contagious respiratory illness caused by influenza viruses.
treatment: Rest, hydration, and antiviral medications in severe cases.
medication_course: Oseltamivir (Tamiflu) 75 mg orally twice daily for 5 days.

name: Diabetes Mellitus Type 2
description: A chronic condition that affects the way the body processes blood sugar (glucose).
treatment: Lifestyle changes, oral medications, and sometimes insulin therapy.
medication_course: Metformin 500 mg orally twice daily; dosage may be adjusted based on blood sugar levels.

name: Hypertension
description: A condition in which the force of the blood against the artery walls is consistently too high.
treatment: Lifestyle modifications and antihypertensive medications.
medication_course: Lisinopril 10 mg orally once daily; dosage may be adjusted based on blood pressure readings.

name: Asthma
description: A respiratory condition marked by spasms in the bronchi of the lungs, causing difficulty in breathing.
treatment: Inhaled corticosteroids and bronchodilators to reduce inflammation and open airways.
medication_course: Albuterol inhaler as needed for symptom relief; inhaled corticosteroids daily.

name: Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD)
description: A group of progressive lung diseases that obstruct airflow and make it difficult to breathe.
treatment: Bronchodilators, inhaled steroids, pulmonary rehabilitation, and oxygen therapy.
medication_course: Tiotropium inhaler once daily; supplemental oxygen as prescribed.

name: Pneumonia
description: An infection that inflames the air sacs in one or both lungs, which may fill with fluid.
treatment: Antibiotics for bacterial pneumonia, rest, and fluids to prevent dehydration.
medication_course: Amoxicillin 500 mg orally three times daily for 7–10 days.

name: Tuberculosis
description: A potentially serious infectious bacterial disease that mainly affects the lungs.
treatment: Long-term antibiotic therapy using a combination of medications.
medication_course: Isoniazid, Rifampin, Ethambutol, and Pyrazinamide for 6–9 months as per DOTS protocol.

name: HIV/AIDS
description: A chronic, potentially life-threatening condition caused by the human immunodeficiency virus (HIV).
treatment: Antiretroviral therapy (ART) to control the virus and prevent progression.
medication_course: Combination ART as prescribed, usually taken daily indefinitely.

name: Malaria
description: A disease caused by a plasmodium parasite, transmitted by the bite of infected mosquitoes.
treatment: Antimalarial medications to eliminate the parasite from the bloodstream.
medication_course: Artemisinin-based combination therapies (ACTs) for 3 days.

name: Dengue Fever
description: A mosquito-borne viral infection causing severe flu-like illness.
treatment: Supportive care including hydration and pain relief; no specific antiviral treatment.
medication_course: Acetaminophen for fever and pain; avoid NSAIDs due to bleeding risk.

name: Hepatitis B
description: A serious liver infection caused by the hepatitis B virus (HBV).
treatment: Antiviral medications to reduce liver inflammation and prevent complications.
medication_course: Entecavir 0.5 mg orally once daily; treatment duration varies.

name: Hepatitis C
description: A liver disease caused by the hepatitis C virus (HCV), leading to inflammation.
treatment: Direct-acting antiviral medications to clear the virus from the body.
medication_course: Sofosbuvir and Ledipasvir combination therapy for 8–12 weeks.

name: COVID-19
description: An infectious disease caused by the SARS-CoV-2 coronavirus.
treatment: Supportive care; antiviral medications and oxygen therapy in severe cases.
medication_course: Remdesivir 200 mg IV on day 1, then 100 mg IV daily for 5–10 days.

name: Alzheimer's Disease
description: A progressive neurodegenerative disorder that causes memory loss and cognitive decline.
treatment: Medications to manage symptoms; no cure exists currently.
medication_course: Donepezil 5 mg orally once daily at bedtime.

name: Parkinson's Disease
description: A degenerative disorder of the central nervous system affecting movement and causing tremors.
treatment: Medications to manage symptoms, such as increasing dopamine levels.
medication_course: Levodopa-Carbidopa 100/25 mg orally three times daily.

name: Osteoarthritis
description: A degenerative joint disease characterized by the breakdown of joint cartilage.
treatment: Pain management, physical therapy, and sometimes joint replacement surgery.
medication_course: Ibuprofen 400 mg orally every 6 hours as needed for pain.

name: Rheumatoid Arthritis
description: An autoimmune disorder causing chronic inflammation of joints.
treatment: Disease-modifying antirheumatic drugs (DMARDs) and biologics.
medication_course: Methotrexate 7.5 mg orally once weekly.

name: Depression
description: A mood disorder causing persistent feelings of sadness and loss of interest.
treatment: Antidepressant medications and psychotherapy.
medication_course: Sertraline 50 mg orally once daily.

name: Anxiety Disorders
description: Mental health disorders characterized by significant anxiety and fear.
treatment: Medications, psychotherapy, and stress management techniques.
medication_course: Escitalopram 10 mg orally once daily.

name: Schizophrenia
description: A chronic brain disorder that affects a person's ability to think, feel, and behave clearly.
treatment: Antipsychotic medications and psychosocial therapy.
medication_course: Risperidone 2 mg orally once daily.

name: Coronary Artery Disease
description: A disease caused by the buildup of plaque resulting in the arteries becoming narrowed or blocked.
treatment: Lifestyle changes, medications, and possibly surgical procedures.
medication_course: Aspirin 81 mg orally once daily; statins as prescribed.

name: Stroke
description: A medical emergency where the blood supply to part of the brain is interrupted or reduced.
treatment: Immediate medical attention, clot-busting drugs, and rehabilitation.
medication_course: Alteplase (tPA) administered intravenously within 3 hours of symptom onset.

name: Epilepsy
description: A neurological disorder marked by sudden recurrent episodes of sensory disturbance.
treatment: Antiepileptic medications to control seizures.
medication_course: Valproic Acid 500 mg orally twice daily.

name: Migraine
description: A neurological condition characterized by intense, debilitating headaches.
treatment: Pain relievers, anti-nausea medications, and preventive medicines.
medication_course: Sumatriptan 50 mg orally at onset; may repeat after 2 hours if needed.

name: Allergic Rhinitis
description: An allergic reaction that causes sneezing, congestion, and runny nose.
treatment: Antihistamines, decongestants, and nasal corticosteroids.
medication_course: Loratadine 10 mg orally once daily.

name: Eczema (Atopic Dermatitis)
description: A condition causing the skin to become inflamed or irritated.
treatment: Moisturizers, topical steroids, and avoiding irritants.
medication_course: Hydrocortisone cream applied to affected areas twice daily.
